title: Remember when 'Ggwp' actually meant something.
body:
Now it's just an obligatory and traditional clichÃ© that teams parrot at the end of a stomp fest.

I noticed so far in S9 (at least in low elo) it is very rare to actually win or lose a game where it was reasonably close.

Whether I win or lose, I like saying 'Ggwp' if it was actually a good game that was well played by both sides.

Not just some hyper mobile champion with an overloaded kit that managed to get fed and snowball off of 1 missplay by the opposing side.

Maybe it's just me but things seem to have gone downhill since S7..

replies.body: It's still a lot better than someone typing EZ.

No, not really. 

Remember gg no re?
I mean I feel like it's just polite? Whether or not one of the teams got stomped, I just do it out of instinct because it just feels more polite..

\> someone disconnects
\> someone else ragequits due to failed /ff
\> two have a dance party in fountain
\> "no" voter farms jungle until losing at 16:00
\> "ggwp"
It's been a meaningless phrase since before WC3.

Dude i had a fking talon who got fed and the only person that could kill him was tryndamere because he had his ult and couldn't die in 3 seconds.

Nothing you can do unless your zed.
